conclusion: Determine the longest propagation time of refracted light in the hemisphere.
The triangle ABC is an equilateral triangle with side length L.
The hemisphere has a radius R, which is equal to L/2.
The light enters the hemisphere through segment BD on side AB, where BD = L/4.
The light enters the hemisphere at point D and travels to the farthest point on the hemisphere.
The farthest point from D on the hemisphere is along the diameter passing through O.
D is located at (-L/4, 0, 0) in a coordinate system where O is at the origin (0, 0, 0).
The farthest point on the hemisphere from D is at (L/2, 0, 0).
The distance d between D and the farthest point is 3L/4.
The speed of light in the hemisphere is c/n, where n is the refractive index.
Assuming the refractive index n = 1.5, the speed of light in the hemisphere is 2c/3.
The longest propagation time of the refracted light in the hemisphere is 9L/8c.
